faqs.question: Les étrangers peuvent-ils acheter un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Yes. Non-EU citizens can purchase Spanish property without residency restrictions. EU and EEA nationals enjoy equivalent property rights to Spanish citizens. Legal frameworks are transparent and straightforward through established conveyancing procedures. Standard documentation includes NIE (tax identification number), property survey, and title verification. Our legal team assists with all regulatory compliance and documentation requirements.

faqs.question: Quels sont les frais d'achat d'un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs typically total 8-10% of property price, comprising transfer tax (6-10% depending on region), legal fees (0.5-1%), notary fees (0.2-0.5%), and surveyor costs (0.1-0.5%). Additional costs include property registration and agency fees. Monthly holding costs include IBI property tax (0.4-0.8% annually), community fees if applicable, and utilities. These costs are transparent and specified during the purchase process.
